required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Neurodynamic Interventions to Multimodal Physical Therapy in Patients With Multiple Sclerosis

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized, parallel-group, clinical trial will be conducted to compare the immediate effects of the inclusion of a neurodynamic intervention into a multimodal physiotherapy program on pressure pain sensitivity, pain and manual dexterity in patients with multiple sclerosis

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and one week after the last treatment session
primary_outcome.description: Pressure pain threshold over the median, ulnar and radial nerves, second metacarpal and tibialis anterior

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in upper extremity pain intensity before and after the intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and one week after the last treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: A Numerical Pain Rate Scale (NPRS, 0-10) will be used to record the mean and the worst intensity of pain in te upper extremity

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in light touch detection threshold
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after treatmentBaseline and one week after the last treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: Light touch detection threshold will be assessed with a standardized set of modified twenty von Frey hairs

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and one week after the last treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: Bilateral manual dexterity was bilaterally assessed using the nine-hole peg test

arm_group.description: Patients will receive 5 session of multimodal physiotherapy treatment of 30min duration including low-load strength exercises, soft tissue mobilization and muscle-tendon stretching exercises twice per week.

Patients will receive 5 session of multimodal physiotherapy treatment of 30min duration including low-load strength exercises, soft tissue mobilization and muscle-tendon stretching exercises twice per week. In addition, they will also receive bilateral nerve slider neurodynamic interventions targeting the median, ulnar and radial nerves.

intervention.description: Patients will receive 5 session of multimodal physiotherapy treatment of 30min duration including low-load strength exercises, soft tissue mobilization and muscle-tendon stretching exercises twice per week.

Patients will receive 5 session of multimodal physiotherapy treatment of 30min duration including low-load strength exercises, soft tissue mobilization and muscle-tendon stretching exercises twice per week. In addition, they will also receive bilateral nerve slider neurodynamic interventions targeting the median, ulnar and radial nerves.
